decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is ramping up mana quickly using the Urza lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to cast powerful colorless threats like Wurmcoil Engine, World Breaker, Walking Ballista, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes control elements like Oblivion Stone and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while utilizing cards like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map to tutor for specific pieces. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and control the board until victory is achieved.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures while disrupting the opponent with removal spells and mana denial. The deck utilizes a mix of Mana dorks, Eldrazi Temples, and efficient ramp spells to quickly deploy threatening creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive creatures like Drowner of Hope and Eldrazi Displacer to control the board and pressure the opponent. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with high-powered threats and disrupt their game plan, ultimately securing a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively use Death's Shadow as a large threat while controlling the board with efficient removal and counterspells. The deck aims to quickly lower its own life total to enable Death's Shadow to become a powerful attacker, while also utilizing other powerful creatures like Gurmag Angler and Snapcaster Mage. Thoughtseize is used to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand help with card selection. This deck seeks to apply pressure and disruption simultaneously to overwhelm opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main idea of this deck is to use Jeskai Ascendancy to create a powerful combo. The deck includes cards that can help dig for the combo pieces, protect the combo, and ensure its success. Cards like Glittering Wish allow for flexibility in finding the necessary pieces, while cards like Birds of Paradise and Sylvan Caryatid help ramp up mana production. By utilizing these cards effectively, the deck can quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and triggers.

This UW Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal, and land disruption while controlling the board with planeswalkers and card advantage. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a win condition, either through a massive card draw with Sphinx's Revelation or by beating down with Celestial Colonnade. It utilizes a combination of spot removal, board wipes, and counterspells to maintain control of the game and outvalue the opponent over the long haul. Flexibility and adaptability are key in piloting this deck to victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's deck by manipulating their draws and preventing them from playing their win conditions. Utilizing cards like Lantern of Insight, Codex Shredder, and Ensnaring Bridge, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and lock them out of the game. With the ability to remove key cards from the opponent's deck using Surgical Extraction and Inquisition of Kozilek, combined with the ability to search for specific answers with Ancient Stirrings and Inventors' Fair, the deck can effectively control the pace of the game and secure a victory through attrition.

The deck focuses on setting up its combo pieces (Ad Nauseam, Angel's Grace, Laboratory Maniac) to quickly draw out the deck and win the game. It uses cards like Pentad Prism and Lotus Bloom to generate mana, while Phyrexian Unlife helps protect you from losing the game. Pact of Negation provides extra protection, while Spoils of the Vault can help find key pieces. The deck aims to cast Ad Nauseam to draw its entire deck, then win either by casting Lightning Storm or by playing Laboratory Maniac and drawing a card to win the game.

This deck focuses on using disruptive creatures like Tidehollow Sculler and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's hand and board while also applying pressure with efficient Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher. The deck also utilizes Lingering Souls for token generation and Collective Brutality for additional disruption and flexibility. The mana base is designed to support the colored requirements of the spells and creatures, with a mix of lands that can produce colored mana efficiently. Finally, the deck includes removal like Path to Exile and Fatal Push to deal with threats from the opponent.

This UW Control deck aims to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful cards like Cryptic Command, Snapcaster Mage, and Supreme Verdict to outlast opponents and control the board state. The deck also has burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix for additional removal and some win conditions. The inclusion of Sphinx's Revelation and Secure the Wastes provide extra card draw and token generation respectively, giving the deck multiple angles of attack. The deck aims to stall the game until it can take over with its powerful late-game threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful land-based synergy of Amulet of Vigor to quickly ramp into Primeval Titan and overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and lands. The deck includes a variety of utility lands, mana accelerants, and card draw to ensure consistency in assembling the key combo pieces. By efficiently manipulating lands and creatures, the deck seeks to establish a dominant board presence and win the game through explosive turns that can be difficult for opponents to disrupt.

The deck revolves around assembling the combo of Ad Nauseam with Angel's Grace or Phyrexian Unlife to draw the entire deck and win the game. It uses cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism to generate mana quickly, while also including protection in the form of Pact of Negation. The goal is to set up the combo as quickly as possible while controlling the game with counterspells like Censor. The deck also includes alternate win conditions like Lightning Storm or Laboratory Maniac if needed.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategy with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while generating card advantage with cards like Dark Confidant and Liliana of the Veil. It also plays efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to deal with opposing threats. The deck combines aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Scavenging Ooze with token generators like Lingering Souls to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly. Additionally, the deck has some utility lands like Gavony Township to provide additional value in the late game.

The deck aims to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana and play powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Wurmcoil Engine. It also includes various counterspells (Condescend, Remand), removal spells (Dismember, Cyclonic Rift), and card advantage engines (Thirst for Knowledge, Snapcaster Mage) to disrupt the opponent's game plan and outvalue them in the late game. The deck is designed to outlast the opponent and win through powerful late-game plays.

The primary focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and artifacts, utilizing cards such as Arcbound Ravager and Cranial Plating to quickly close out games. The strategy revolves around quickly establishing a board presence with low-cost creatures like Vault Skirge and Signal Pest, then using cards like Steel Overseer to pump them up and deal massive damage. The inclusion of powerful artifacts like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum allows for explosive plays and efficient mana ramping. Overall, this deck aims to win through fast, aggressive gameplay and synergistic interactions between its cards.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays by utilizing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Scavenging Ooze, along with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also includes removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push to control the board, while also having card advantage through cards like Dark Confidant and Liliana of the Veil. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Traverse the Ulvenwald helps ensure consistency in drawing threats and hitting land drops. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient Eldrazi creatures while disrupting their hand with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. It also includes removal spells like Path to Exile and Collective Brutality to control the board. The Eldrazi creatures, such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, provide powerful threats that can finish the game quickly. The deck also utilizes Eldrazi Displacer for additional disruption and value. Overall, the deck focuses on aggressive play while disrupting the opponent's game plan.
